info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 7:30PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN MASON, NORTHEASTERN BRACKEN AND SOUTHERN BROWN COUNTIES THROUGH 800 PM EDT... At 730 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Augusta, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, half inch hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Maysville, Georgetown, Ripley, Augusta, Decatur, Russellville, Dover, Higginsport, Minerva, Redoak, Lake Waynoka, South Ripley, State Route 32 at US Route 62, Tuckahoe and Stoney Point. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
